decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while digging for key cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils. By utilizing cards like Dovin's Veto and Supreme Verdict, it maintains control over the board while setting up for powerful plays with March of Otherworldly Light. With its variety of removal options and card draw spells, the deck looks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in order to secure victory.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly casting Arclight Phoenix by maximizing spells that can be cast for low cost or can be cast from the graveyard. The deck includes cards like Treasure Cruise and Temporal Trespass to refill the hand and continue casting spells. Lightning Axe, Fiery Impulse, and Picklock Prankster provide removal and disruption to control the board. The deck also includes cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand for card selection and efficient mana usage. The goal is to swarm the opponent with threats and overwhelm them before they can establish a strong defense.

The deck focuses on using the combo between Greasefang and Parhelion II to generate a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. It includes support cards like Fleeting Spirit, Monument to Endurance, and Seasoned Hallowblade to protect the combo pieces and maintain control of the game. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Sheltered by Ghosts to disrupt the opponent's strategy and clear the way for the combo to go off. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on setting up a powerful mana base with Lotus Field and various land ramp cards to quickly generate a large amount of mana. By utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Scapeshift, the goal is to assemble a win condition such as Thassa's Oracle to win the game in one big combo turn. The deck also includes Wishclaw Talisman for tutoring key pieces and Stock Up for card draw. The key strategy is to efficiently ramp into a game-winning combo while navigating through disruption from the opponent.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful legendary creatures and aggressive tactics. By utilizing cards like Scheming Symmetry to search for key cards and Relic of Legends to ramp up mana, the deck can consistently put strong threats on the board. With a mix of creatures like Arachne, Psionic Weaver and Nashi, Searcher in the Dark, the deck can maintain pressure while controlling the board. The mana base is focused on supporting the five-color legend theme, ensuring that the deck can consistently play its powerful spells.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays, supported by burn spells and combat tricks to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. The deck includes efficient creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear, along with powerful pump spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature damage and direct burn spells, utilizing the deck's mix of creatures and spells to maintain a relentless tempo and secure victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures, removal spells, and disruption to overwhelm opponents. It utilizes powerful cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, Bloodtithe Harvester, and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to apply pressure quickly. Thoughtseize and Duress disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Fatal Push and Go for the Throat efficiently deal with threats. The deck is designed to keep up the pressure and force the opponent to react, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of damage and disruption.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays and disruption to overwhelm opponents quickly. It includes powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the board. Thoughtseize and Duress help disrupt opponents' plans, while Mutavault and Blood Crypt provide mana fixing. The deck also features unconventional cards like Fear of Missing Out and Graveyard Trespasser to keep the pressure on opponents. Overall, the deck aims to be fast, disruptive, and relentless in its attack.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures to apply early pressure on the opponent while also utilizing artifact creatures like Ornithopter and Cosmogrand Zenith for added versatility and synergy. The deck also includes removal spells like Gleeful Demolition and Cori-Steel Cutter to deal with opposing threats, as well as powerful anthem effects from cards like Venerated Loxodon and Shefet Dunes to boost the team's power and toughness. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and aggressive combat strategies to win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on using Lotus Field as a key card to generate a large amount of mana quickly in order to cast powerful spells and activate abilities. By utilizing cards like Scapeshift and Arboreal Grazer, the deck aims to ramp up mana production and combo off to overwhelm opponents with big plays. The inclusion of cards like Wishclaw Talisman and Stock Up help to search for key pieces and maintain hand advantage. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces efficiently and execute a game-winning sequence of plays.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on relentless aggression, utilizing cheap and efficient spells and creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck aims to apply early pressure with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, while also relying on burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to clear the path for an all-out assault. The inclusion of cards like Heroes' Hangout and Kumano Faces Kakkazan provide additional reach and resilience against removal and board wipes, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive strategy throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence and deal damage to the opponent as efficiently as possible. It uses cheap spells and creatures to control the tempo of the game and push through damage. By utilizing cards that provide card advantage like Treasure Cruise and Consider, as well as efficient removal like Fiery Impulse and Torch the Tower, the deck aims to stay ahead in card advantage and overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive creatures like Stormchaser's Talent and Slickshot Show-Off.

Utilize a combination of efficient removal spells, disruptive discard spells, and aggressive creatures to overwhelm your opponent and maintain control of the battlefield. The deck aims to disrupt your opponent's game plan while pressuring them with evasive threats, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of efficient removal and creature damage. The deck's synergistic cards help to maintain a consistent tempo and disrupt your opponent's strategy, with a focus on utilizing efficient and powerful cards to assert dominance in the early game.

The deck focuses on using aggressive Spirit creatures to deal consistent damage to the opponent while maintaining disruption through counter spells and removal. The key strategy is to curve out efficiently, utilizing tempo plays to keep the opponent on the back foot. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of evasive threats and disruptive elements, creating pressure and controlling the pace of the game. With a mix of efficient creatures and versatile spells, the deck aims to close out the game quickly with a relentless assault.

Utilizing a combination of creatures and spells, this deck aims to efficiently control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up for a powerful combo involving Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize for disruption, as well as Seasoned Hallowblade for protection, the deck can buy time to assemble its combo pieces. The inclusion of cards like Fleeting Spirit and Monument to Endurance provide additional utility and resilience, making it a versatile and potent deck in the Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix repeatedly from the graveyard to deal consistent damage to the opponent. It also utilizes card draw and selection spells to find the necessary pieces to execute the strategy efficiently. The inclusion of removal spells and disruptive creatures helps maintain board control and protect the Phoenixes. The deck aims to be a fast-paced and aggressive deck that can overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures.
